title: Medical Treatment Long Stay Visa (subclass 685)
summary: This page provides information for people who currently hold, or previously applied for, the Medical Treatment Long Stay Visa (subclass 685), which closed to new applications on 23 March 2013. It explains visa validity, rights, obligations, and options for extending stay or having others join the visa holder. The page also outlines requirements for notifying the department of changes in personal circumstances.

visa_details.validity_information: Valid until the expiry date given when the visa was granted

applicant_scope.description: Information is for people who already hold the visa or applied before closure and have not yet received a decision

visa_validity.duration: Until the date provided in the grant notification
visa_validity.purpose_of_duration: To give time for medical treatment

eligible_reasons: Medical treatment continues beyond visa expiry
extending_stay.requirement: Must apply for and be granted the next visa before current visa ends

allowed_activities: Stay in Australia for medical treatment
Study for up to three months
visa_entitlements.study_exceptions: Longer than three months allowed if under 18 and circumstances change with compelling and compassionate reasons

eligible_support_persons: Someone who wants to come to provide emotional and other support during treatment

application_methods.form: Form 48ME Application to visit Australia for medical treatment

in_australia.lodgement: Post or fax to the Canberra office in Australian Capital Territory
payment_methods: Money order payable to the Department of Home Affairs

obligations.work_restrictions: Cannot work except under limited circumstances
obligations.study_restrictions: Can study for up to three months unless exceptions apply

departure_requirements.possibility_of_another_visa: Might be able to apply for another visa if more medical treatment is needed
departure_requirements.notes: Medical Treatment visas are usually granted for a short time only

changes_to_report: Changes to phone number, email, address, or passport
change_notification.consequences_of_not_reporting_passport_c: May cause significant delays at the airport and possible denial of permission to board a plane
